Description: Shoulder and body sherd (mended from eight fragments with plaster fill) of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: from top, trace of a painted dividing band consisting of dot and billet pattern at junction of neck and shoulder; below, tongue friezes above panel; on shoulder, from left, traces of bull to right with head lowered and part of panther to left with frontal face; roughly glazed behind handle; below, dividing band of dot and billet pattern; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: According to Cook, the sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1099, but the interior curvature and scale of both sherds are different. The additional sherd with registration number British Museum 1924,1201.1098 given by Cook, and followed by Johnston in a version of this database, was re-registered in error. The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1965,0930.975. For the confronted bull and panther, see the unpublished pieces from Miletus (Z05.19.407 and Z05.19), both found in the sanctuary of Aphrodite in 2005.
